body_content.explanation: the act of colonizing a country (= sending people to live in and govern it) again, for a second, third, etc. time:
examples: Nation-building is also seen as a form of re-colonization.
Public officials throughout the Caribbean regularly complained of the recolonization of the region.
Some see the move as re-colonisation in Africa.

body_content.explanation: the act of animals, plants, or organisms starting to live or grow again in a particular area, or of encouraging animals, etc. to live or grow somewhere:
examples: The many miles of treeless river inhibits re-colonization by otters.
Some butterfly species require recolonization every year from source populations.
